You take control a giant space fly known as a Yar, and you must destroy the Qotile base on the other side of the screen. But you must first get through the large shield that guards the base. Fortunately, you have an unlimited supply of missiles to destroy the shield, or you can fly into the shield and eat a brick. Once there is an opening in the shield, touch the Qotile base with the Yar to activate the Zorlon Cannon. Once activated, you can fire the cannon to destroy the base. As you progress through the 250 levels, the game moves faster and becomes more challenging. Help Yar destroy the Qotile in YAR'S REVENGE.

title: Gallop Racer
description: Can you name the three races of the Triple Crown? Do you know what horse last won the Triple Crown? Does the name Man O' War mean anything to you? If you answered, Yes, to these questions, then GALLOP RACER is for you. You start by creating a jockey, and then picking a horse; every horse has unique attributes as well as a unique temperament. Entering horses into races is easy, but winning takes extensive knowledge. You will need to know which horses run well on turf and which do better on dirt, as well as which animals are sprinters and which prefer long distance. As you win more races and buy more steeds, you will be able to breed the animals to create the perfect thoroughbred. If all of these options and decisions sound confusing, use the Practice mode to jump on a mount and ride around the track. GALLOP RACER brings the sport of kings to your living room.

title: Championship Motocross Featuring Ricky Carmichael
description: CHAMPIONSHIP MOTOCROSS FEATURING RICKEY CARMICHAEL brings the jumps and stunts of motocross racing to the PlayStation. Pick a bike from three categories 125cc, 250cc, and 500cc and customize it. Then use the Practice mode to learn how to get the most out of your vehicle. When you feel comfortable turning and burning, challenge all comers to a single race on one of 12 tracks, or endure the ups and downs of a season. With the championship in hand, challenge your friends to some head-to-head action. No matter what mode you play, the thumping tunes of Vanilla Ice, Godsmack, and others will draw you into the action. CHAMPIONSHIP MOTOCROSS will challenge all of your driving skills.

title: NHL 2000
description: If you're taken out by a Monster Hit, redemption is easy- drop the gloves and slug it out in a good old-fashioned BROOH HA-HA. Pick up and play with the tutorial level, or take a team from cellar to the Stanley Cup in new Dynasty Mode. PlayStation will reward you with fast-paced 'arcade' style gameplay. PC will allow you to take the shots, deliver the hits and set up your favorite players with the 'Import Your Face' feature. PlayStation or PC, NHL 2000 is your ticket to an action-packed NHL season.

title: Gex: Enter the Gecko
description: After saving the television realm from destruction, Gex retired to Maui. Unfortunately, Rez has returned and wants to take over the television realm again. Now Gex must come out of retirement. Guide him through 26 levels, each with a number of missions to complete. Finishing a mission will earn a remote control; collect enough remotes and new stages open. In all of the levels, Gex will have to either avoid or fight enemies. Luckily, he is equipped with a tail that can whip the bad guys into shape. To further aid in the fight, Gex can eat flies that will grant him an extra life or increase the power of his attacks, among other things. Help the gecko with attitude save the television realm in GEX: Enter the Gecko.
platforms: GBC PS Vita N64 PSP PC PS3

title: Battleship [1999]
description: Now it's your turn to sink your opponent's battleship in this Game Boy Color rendition of the classic strategic board game. Players deploy all four of their ships to different areas on a grid, and take turns firing shots at various parts of their opponent's grid. Hit each ship the required number of times, and the ship is removed from play. In a unique twist on the classic game, each ship has new weapons. For the solo player, there are 48 missions to complete with animated full-color cutscenes to inspire you to victory! The real challenge however, is taking on a human opponent via a link cable. Forget setting up the board and looking for missing pieces, this is the real way to play Battleship!
platforms: GBC NES Cell GB CD-i GG

title: Disciples: Sacred Lands
description: Disciples is a turn-based fantasy strategy game that is clearly inspired by the Heroes Of Might & Magic series, and that is not a bad thing. Like Heroes, you have a town that you upgrade with new structures that give you access to new creatures. Like Heroes, you trot small groups around the map to claim resources and fight neutral monsters guarding treasures. Like Heroes, while all this is happening, some tough computer opponents (with quite good AI) are engaging in the same tasks as both sides prepare for the inevitable clash. So the basic gameplay is running a few groups around, fighting things, grabbing resources, upgrading your capital city, and then attempting to meet the victory conditions. This is all very much like Heroes Of Might and Magic. But let's talk about how Disciples veers off on a very satisfying different course.

title: Monaco Grand Prix
description: MONACO GRAND PRIX lets you race your customized vehicle on 16 different Formula 1 tracks from around the world. You can tweak your car to your own specifications: adjust the steering angle, fuel quantity, type of tires, or angles of front and rear wings, among other options. The result is your very own ultimate driving machine. See if you can negotiate the twists and turns of each track, and keep an eye on the action with any of seven different camera views. In addition to Single Race, Time Attack and Championship Circuit modes, the game features a multi-season Career mode, in which you can lose your spot on the team if you have a bad track record. Put the pedal to the metal and see where the MONACO GRAND PRIX can take you!

title: Vegas Games 2000
description: Lay your cards on the table in a virtual Casino Royale with VEGAS GAMES 2000. Are you a gambling fan with high-roller tastes and scant real-life funds? Never fear all the high-stakes, action-crammed gaming excitement you need is here to be savored. Grab your hefty 5,000-dollar stake and choose from 21 casino games like Blackjack, Roulette, Baccarat, Craps, Poker (table and video), and a wide variety of clanging and flashing slots. Check out the manual's helpful instructions and gambling hints and go to town with Draw, Stud, or Texas Hold 'Em Poker. If Video Poker is more your style, you can enjoy Jacks or Better, Double Down, Jokers Wild, and others. In VEGAS GAMES 2000 you can play Single, Two, or Four-deck Blackjack, Buffet, Ancient Treasures, or Easy Money slots while enjoying all the sights and sounds of real casino action. And with multiplayer support for up to four players, you'll never have to lose your money alone.

title: Silver
description: Terror grips the land. The powerful and evil Sorcerer Silver has abducted the women of Jarrah for his treacherous purposes. Take control as David, a simple hero on a quest to save his beloved and defeat the almighty Silver. But it won't be easy. In order to succeed you'll need to recruit allies, master swordplay, learn the art of magic, and venture through hostile worlds teeming with Silver's corrupt followers.

title: NHL FaceOff 2000
description: In NHL FACEOFF 2000 you can make trades, release slackers, create a player, and sign free agents. You'll get gameplay modes like Season, Exhibition, Quick Start. One new feature is Multi-Team play, which lets more than one user play within the same season and creates the potential for some great rivalries. FACEOFF 2000 is officially licensed and has all the real NHL teams and players.

title: Panzer General 3D Assault
description: In this edition of the successful turn-based strategy series, the gameplay has been upgraded to fully 3D environments in which forests can burn, cities and airfields can be destroyed and the terrain alters as you crush and conquer your enemies. Promote, dismiss or reassign your commanders to build the most powerful units in all of WWII.

title: WCW Mayhem
description: Are you one of those guys that sits at home and watches every episode of WCW Mayhem? Are you one of those guys that feels he didn't get enough out of it when it is all over? If you are, now all you have to do is switch on your N64 and finish the job with WCW Mayhem from EA Sports, if it's on the show its in the game.

title: Rats!
description: Marlon Mozzarella's daughter has been kidnapped. It is up to you, a rat with sunglasses and an attitude, to save the rodent you love. Marlon has sent his men as well but, unfortunately, they are not going to help you. Marlon has kidnapped his own daughter, and he doesn't want you to find her. You must navigate over 70 levels, in which the goal is to collect all of the food. Once the chow is yours, the exit to the next levels opens. Since Marlon's goons are after you, a gun will become your best friend. However, the biggest enemy is time if you don't get out of the level within the time limit, the angel of death will stalk you. Try to rescue your beloved and avoid the mobsters in RATS!

title: Las Vegas Cool Hand
description: Las Vegas is the gambling capital of the world. Every game in the world has some kind of action in Sin City. Now you can travel to Vegas and try to win some virtual dollars in LAS VEGAS COOL HAND. Play three classic card games: Blackjack, Solitaire, and Cribbage. All of the games have four different variations to play. In Blackjack, the goal is to get as close to 21 as possible without going over, while also beating the dealer's hand. Solitaire has the player trying to place stacks of cards in order and removing the cards one by one. The goal in Cribbage is to be the first person to score 121 points. Take a trip to sin city and try to break the bank in LAS VEGAS COOL HAND.

title: Prince of Persia 3D
description: The legendary Prince of Persia breaks into the third dimension with this remake of the classic. Guide the prince through environmental dangers and puzzles on his quest to save the life of his wife, the Princess. The game plays much like Tomb Raider, requiring you to move the Prince through the levels and engage in occasional combat from a third person, over the shoulder view.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: NFL 2K
description: Why watch the game on TV when you can be right there on the turf, delivering bullet passes and bone-crushing tackles along side the pros? Sega Dreamcast now gives you NFL-approved 3D football, created with playbooks designed by seasoned coaches to mimic the play-calling tendencies of real NFL teams. More than 1,300 motion-captured moves, shot with pro players, referees and stuntmen, create the most realistic sports gameplay ever. You'll even get rained on or shouted at by the animated crowd, adding to the incredible detail and momentum of the game. Time to put those other football games out to pasture. Dreamcast scores.

title: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Rogue Spear
description: Rogue Spear is a shooter of a different cut. One without health packs and super-futuristic weapons. Death is as close as one shot away -- and since you're usually taking on a superior number of forces, the game stresses solid strategy and planning instead of running in with guns blazing. While your anti-terrorist organization will see action on three continents, most of Rogue Spear takes place in parts of Russia and the former Soviet states. Those familiar with Rainbow Six will be able to jump right into Rogue Spear without having to even crack open the manual. The controls are basically the same as in the original, with a few keys remapped to give it the playability of a more standard shooter. Like Rainbow Six, when you start a mission, you can either opt to go with the pre-determined routes, weapon loadouts, and squad assignments or choose your own. You can customize all of your team members and their paths if you want.
platforms: PC DC GBA PS PS Mac

title: WipEout 3
description: The WIPEOUT series returns to the PlayStation with WIPEOUT 3. The game centers on teams of futuristic racers who pilot hovercraft and compete for the coveted championship. WIPEOUT 3 offers eight different hovercrafts (each representing a different team), which contain varying statistics for such things as speed and handling. There are a total of eight new tracks, which feature a huge number of the tight turns and great drops that have made the series famous. The graphics have received a huge upgrade, with everything bumped up to high-resolution, which makes all of the polygons much cleaner and clearer. There is again music from top techno bands like The Chemical Brothers and Orbital, to help giver the player a greater adrenaline rush during the whole ordeal. Also, the Two-Player mode appears to give gamers even more of a challenge. WIPEOUT 3 takes the basics that made the series what it is today, and adds to them in every possible way.

title: Pandora's Box
description: Developed by famed Tetris creator Alexey Pajitnov, Microsoft's Pandora Box offers over 300 unique puzzles that come to life on your computer to stimulate your visual senses. Take a break to enjoy solving a puzzle, or immerse yourself in a worldwide search to capture seven mythical trickters by solving a series of puzzles.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Omega Boost
description: This on-rails shooter will provide plenty of excitement for gamers looking for a shooter fix. You have a host of lethal weapons at your disposal including homing missiles, lasers, and cluster bombs. Another unique feature of this game is the fact that you have control of your mech, even though the game is on rails. What this means is that you can dodge incoming fire and missiles or rotate in search of the best shot. Control-wise, a targeting system has been implemented with both manual and automatic lock-on firing, which puts you in complete control. There is also a special gallery section that allows you to check out all the big mechs in the game.

title: Army Men: Sarge's Heroes
description: The ARMY MEN series expands with 3DO's ARMY MEN: Sarge's Heroes. Take control of Sarge, the green grunt looking to recruit the right toys for the mission at hand the destruction of the imperious Tan Army. Your toy army is itching to get its hands on weapons of mass destruction: the plastic melting magnifying glass, the garbage disposal, and the skyrockets. Evil will reign supreme if the Tan Army gains control of the weapons. As Sarge, you'll switch between the Plastic World, where you're built to scale, and the Real World, where even the tiniest dangers can be deadly. Luckily, Sarge isn't alone. The toy soliders can utilize nine different characters, each rendered with revolutionary Plastosheen lighting effects, as they march through 14 missions containing 70 objectives, and fight with 13 different weapons. As if this combat isn't enough for the most battle grizzled veterans, multiplayer options give you the opportunity to blow your friends to bits.

title: NFL Fever 2000
description: Microsoft NFL Fever 2000 is intense, in-your-face NFL football action. Featuring fast-paced gameplay, hard-hitting tackles, smooth movements, slick graphics, real-time commentary and real NFL-style playbooks and gameplay, NFL Fever puts you in total control.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Hot Wheels: Turbo Racing
description: Were you one of those kids who had a huge collection of Hot Wheels growing up? Did you spend most of your time crashing them together and dropping them off of sofas and tables? If so, then HOT WHEELS TURBO RACING may be just the game for you. The 40 cars here are all modeled after their real-life toy counterparts (both past and present), and the tracks themselves even look like plastic Hot Wheels pieces. You'll send your racers looping through twisting corkscrews, zipping around hairpin turns, and of course, up into the air for some high-flying jumps. HOT WHEELS TURBO RACING for the N64 is all about performing wild stunts and tricks, and an arcade-styled physics model means you'll be spinning, rolling, and back-flipping your way to metal-busting racing fun. Last, but not least, a varied mix of musicians like Primus and the Reverend Horton Heat provide a rocking soundtrack.

title: Quake II
description: After years of waging war against the alien aggressors, Earth is on the verge of being completely annihilated. One last effort to bring the mass destruction to an end is underway. You are part of a secret assault force sent to fight your way through heavily fortified military installations in order to lower the aliens defenses and shut down their war machine. Only then can Earth hope to launch an air assault. Only then will the fate of all humanity be known. Welcome to Quake II.Based on the best-selling PC series of the same name, Quake II for PlayStation sends you blasting through 19 levels and six worlds, as you try to make it out of each military base intact. There will be numerous environmental hazards including traps, slime, lava, and radiation but your mission will always be clear, due to the ocular implant you've received. The 10 different weapons you'll use along your adventure range from the regular Blaster to the slightly less regular Chain Guns and Rocket Launchers. Also, keep your eyes peeled for the 14 different items groups floating around out there from health kits to silencers to all sorts of power-ups. The game features a Multiplayer mode, as well as single-player modes like Deathmatch, Frag Team, Flag Wars, and Death Tag, in which you win the game by carrying the flag the longest.
platforms: PS PC GP32 PC N64 PC Mac PC Web

title: Thousand Arms
description: Meis Triumph is a spirit blacksmith and the guardian of Kant. One day he is forced to leave his ancestral home by a gang of ruthless thugs. Luckily, he makes it to the capital city of Boyzby where he meets Sodina. Her brother Jyabil is a master spirit blacksmith and takes Triumph as an apprentice. However, the army that forced Meis out of Kant has its eyes on Boyzby. This is the start of your adventure to save the world. What separates THOUSAND ARMS from other role-playing games is its Master system. Since you (as Meis) are a spirit blacksmith, you can use your skills to improve the weapons and items your party carries. However, to gain better skills as a blacksmith you must answer questions from Sodina and try to keep her happy. If you is successful your intimacy level increases and you'll will learn new skills. It's up to you to save the world in THOUSAND ARMS.
rating_content: Mild Animated Violence, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes

title: Demolition Racer
description: DEMOLITION RACER brings the action of demolition racing to the PlayStation. Choose from nine cars, hit one of the 11 tracks, and play a single race with one of several options. Demolition has the player trying to wreck the oppositions' cars while finishing in first place. In Chase, just try to be first and not destructive drivers behind you catch up. A Chicken race has all of the other cars racing at you head on. Last Man Standing and Suicide are destruction derbies where you want to be the last person running and the first person out, respectively. Those who want more of a challenge should try to work their way through the rookie, semi-pro, pro, endurance, and arena demolition leagues. If friends think you play the game like a girl, then challenge them with the two-player game. Do you have the skills to survive all these modes? Play DEMOLITION RACER and find out.

title: WCW Mayhem
description: WCW Mayhem, the first wrestling title published by Electronic Arts, present key features that set it apart from all of the other wrestling games on the market. EA knew they needed to create a brand new engine if they desired to compete in the competitive world of Wrestling entertainment. EA did just that by adding features never seen before in a game, the ability to fight backstage, in a garage and all kinds of odd places that help make the sport of wrestling admired across the nation.

title: Rage of Mages 2: Necromancer
description: Rage of Mages II merges the elements of role-playing and real-time strategy. Recruit stalwart allies, gather powerful weapons, and wield awesome magic as you complete important quests and train your character. The game requires you to seek out the source of an undead menace that is terrorizing the land and obtain an ancient artifact of immense power to stop the evil onslaught. Rage of Mages II includes a multiplayer map editor.

title: BattleTanx: Global Assault
description: Sequel to 3DO's popular multiplayer tank battle fest. This time around players can expect a whole slew of new goodies ranging from enhanced graphics to improved framerates and more deathmatch modes than ever before. In the year 2002 the world has turned into a diseased, post-apocalyptic wastelands. As the human race struggles to rebuild society, a young boy who possesses rare tele-kinetic abilities holds the key to a better world. However, an evil QueenLord wants this boy's powers for her own so that she may destroy what is left of civilization. Using a variety of tanks and weapons, players must rescue this powerful child from the hands of evil and deliver him into the safe arms of the allies. Only then can peace be restored upon the land.

title: Puzzle Link
description: Enter a colorful world of exciting puzzles with Puzzle Link for the NeoGeo Pocket Color. Puzzle Link's puzzle pieces are easy to see, allowing you to concentrate on the challenging gameplay. Are you a strategist or do you like fast-paced games? Puzzle Link as three game modes to satisfy all players: the normal game demands quick thinking and reflexes' the clear-all game rewards those with a well-thought-out strategy; the battle game lets you compete with friends. Earn character cards by clearing the normal game levels quickly and get a sepcial rewards when you collect them all.

title: Puyo Pop
description: Puzzle game in which players align two colored globs of glue as they fall into the pit, rotating them into four positions. When they fall into the bin, they'll link up with like colors. If four or more of the same color link together, they'll disappear and the rest of the globs will fall into the pit, possibly forming more links and chain reactions. In Puyo Pop, you're fighting against different computer AI â you each have your own pit to worry about, and you each get the exact same pattern of globs to rotate and place. If you form multiple chains that fall and disappear, you'll send piles of dead rocks over to your opponent â the bigger the chain reaction, the more rocks get dumped on your opponent. The only way you can get rid of these rocks is to create links on top of them â when the link disappears, so do the surrounding rocks. If your bin fills to the brim, it's game over.

title: Fly!
description: FLY! is the ultimate flight simulator for beginners to experts. Cessna 172R, Piper Malibu Mirage, Piper Navajo Chieftain, Beechcraft King Air B200 and Raytheon Hawker 800XP are the five distinct aircrafts you have the pleasure of choosing from. Experience everything from avionics, to aircraft controls, to radio and GPS systems. These aircrafts were modeled to the exact specifications from the original aircraft and systems manufacturer. While navigating through the sky, there are five cities that show rich detail of scenery.  These cities are San Francisco, Los Angeles, Dallas, Chicago and New York. Configurable weather conditions include thunderstorms, snow, rain and volumetric clouds.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Antz
description: Based on the hit movie from DreamWorks, ANTZ for the Game Boy Color is a wild platform adventure that spans 19 levels. Playing as both Z and Princess Bala in this single-player adventure from Infogrames, you'll advance through side-scrolling scenes taken straight from the movie. Beautifully-detailed graphics capture the essence of the jaw-dropping movie visuals in each of the levels, and varied mission goals keep the gameplay fresh throughout. Use pick-axes to dispatch your foes, but look out for common ant disasters like the dreaded magnifying glass. Even a simple shoe can prove to be a major problem when you are ant-sized! Can you defeat the evil General Mandible and save your colony? Save your progress with a handy password feature when you're finished playing for the day. ANTZ is giant-sized fun for everyone!

title: Mario Golf [Game Boy Color]
description: Take on the challenges of the links with MARIO GOLF. Choose from 10 different characters including Mario, Luigi, and Wario, and hit one of four courses. Learn the controls and hit some balls in the Practice mode, and when you are ready for some competition, play a round of Match or Stroke play. For tough competition, try to win a Tournament, and for the ultimate challenge, join the Mario Club. In this mode you start out as a student. Eventually, you will be able to work your way through the professional ranks and become the world's best golfer. Use a link-cable to challenge a friend to a round in the Versus mode. As an added bonus, the cartridge can save the 20 best shots in the game. Play MARIO GOLF, and put the action of the links into the palm of you hand.

title: Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace
description: Following the plot of the movie, Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace lets you fight through 11 levels of action. At various points in the game you will get to take control of Obi-Wan Kenobi, Qui-Gon Jinn, Queen Amidala, and Captain Panaka. Each character has a special ability or weapon to use: Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon use lightsabers and force powers, Queen Amidala's blaster can stun druids, and Captain Panaka uses a Naboo blaster. While working through each level, you can pick up new weapons like light-repeating blasters, blaster rifles, proton missile launchers, heavy blasters, thermal detonators, Gungan energy balls, flash grenades, and heavy repeating cannons. If you've seen the movie, you'll have a pretty good idea of what to expect. See if you can free Naboo from the treacherous trade federation in Star Wars: Episode I: The Phantom Menace.

title: Xena: Warrior Princess
description: There has been a mishap atop Mount Olympus, and the only person who can resolve it is XENA: Warrior Princess. Kalabrax, a foe whom Xena had previously defeated, has escaped from his prison and is ready to destroy the world for her own benefit. To accomplish this she has captured Gabrielle the Queen of the Amazons and Xena's friend and plans to sacrifice her. It's up to you, as Xena, to save your friend and once again take care of Kalabrax. There are 21 different levels of action that will take you all over the mythological world: islands, mountains, and deserts, each with different types of enemies and puzzles. You must use every weapon at your disposal, including your famous Chakram to make your way to Gabrielle. The game also contains magical spells you can use, such as lightning and ice attacks. XENA: Warrior Princess contains all of the energy of the show, though now it all fits into an exciting and compelling interactive experience.

title: Expert Pool
description: The real-life bars, clubs, and tournaments of the pool world come to 3D life in this immaculate take on shooting stick. Play a variety of classic variations, such as 3-Ball, 8-Ball, 9-Ball, Straight Pool, Billiards, and more. If the fancy stuff is more your thing, you'll enjoy comprehensive trick shot training and practice. Enter into a tournament, play a friendly game, or challenge a friend to a head-to-head showdown for bragging rights. There are almost 200 unique computer opponents to take on, or you can challenge hundreds of online gamers to a shootout.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: V-Rally Edition '99
description: Rally racing meets off-road mayhem, as you choose your fully equipped ride and take to the expanses of the great outdoors. This is truly some of the most oddball racing you'll ever encounter, as you journey through a series of unlikely locales from the outer reaches of Indonesia to the top of France's snow-capped peaks. The weather and track conditions are selected at random, so you'll never quite know what to expect at the race's outset. The eight unique race locations are augmented by variable times of day and lighting conditions as well, and there are over 30 tracks at your disposal. The game is at its best in Championship mode, in which you race in each of the game's locations, scoring points for high finishes in each setting. There are plenty of cars to choose from to begin with, but you'll unlock access to even more as your games progress. You can even take on a friend in a multiplayer slugfest that puts other games to shame. Buckle up this one's going to be bumpy.

title: NBA Inside Drive 2000
description: NBA Inside Drive 2000 is Microsoft?s answer to the monopoly that EA Sports has on the PC Basketball market with its NBA Live series. Microsoft claims it has a winner in this title. It offers team specific styles of play. Try to take on Shaq and the Triangle-Offense. Go up against Karl Malone and his rough style of play, or dare to go against the Portland Trailblazers and the true ?team? concept. It?s all here!

title: Tonic Trouble
description: As Ed the extraterrestrial, you must retrieve a mysterious can that was accidentally dropped from space and is causing havoc on Earth - solve zany problems and avoid traps in this cartoon-like adventure game.

title: Monopoly [1999]
description: The classic board game of property management, MONOPOLY, comes to the Game Boy Color. Choose from a wide array of tokens including the car, boot, thimble, and dog. When you get out on the board, your goal is to buy three properties of the same color. When another player lands on your property, he or she must pay you rent. Eventually, you will want to improve your property with houses and hotels so you can charge higher rents. The ultimate goal of the game is to drive all of the competition into bankruptcy. The Game Boy Color edition features all of the classic MONOPOLY gameplay and high stakes. There are eight variations of the game you can play: The Big Boys, Trader's Delight, Even Steven, Small Stuff, Money Isn't Everything, Short and Sweet, Building Shortage, and It's a Start. If you don't get this game, you will not be able to pass "Go" or collect $200.

title: Spawn
description: Special agent Al Simmons was tricked by his team and assassinated. After traveling to Hell, Simmons make a deal with the devil to get revenge. However, the deal was twisted and Simmons became a minion of Hell he became Spawn. Rather than accept this fate, Spawn searches for the opportunity to free himself from his misguided deal. You take control of Spawn as he fights his way through nine levels of action. In each of the stages, Spawn must eliminate the bad guys using punches, kicks, and any weapons he can find. However, there is always a chain weapon attached to Spawn's chest that can be used to eliminate nearby enemies. Occasionally, Spawn will have to chase evil down while riding a motorcycle. Help defeat the devil, and set SPAWN free.

title: Goemon's Great Adventure
description: Essentially an updated version of Goemon 2 (Super Famicom) featuring polygonal 2D sidescrolling levels that require platform jumping, whacking enemies, pushing around boxes or rocks, and puzzle solving. There are five distinct areas in the game, from the green hills around Edo (Tokyo) Castle over ghostly underground graveyards to a flying city in the sky. The different areas are made up of five types of stages: Road/action stages, town stage, gate stage, castle stage and Impact stage. The fearsome foursome of Goemon, Ebisumaru, Sasuke and Yae are called in to witness the Wiseman of Iga's latest invention: the super-gorgeous ghost return machine. But the evil nun Bisumaru steals the machine and uses it to resurrect Dochuki, the blue-skinned boss of the underworld. It's again up to Goemon to save the world from certain doom, not to mention a flood of smaller ghosts accidentally released by Bisumaru.

title: Motocross Maniacs 2
description: The action of motocross comes to the Game Boy Color with MOTOCROSS MANIACS 2. Hop on a motorcycle and hit the bumps, jumps, and loops of each track. Try to earn the fastest time in the Time Trial mode or take on five different tracks in the Championship mode. No matter how you play, there are power-ups scattered throughout the tracks including nitros, mini riders, jets, gasoline, super suspension, speed, and radials. If you don't like any of the 10 packaged tracks, you can create your own with the Track Editor option. There are a total of 255 obstacles and 32 different items that can be placed on any of the three tracks that you create. Once you have a masterpiece, share it with a friend via a link cable. Get motocross action with MOTOCROSS MANIACS 2.

title: The Chessmaster 7000
description: For more than 12 years, Chessmaster has been undefeated as the leading interactive chess product worldwide. Now, Mindscape Entertainment introduces Chessmaster 7000, the perfect chess companion for all age groups and skill levels. Chessmaster 7000 patiently guides beginners through the game, while intermediate and expert players can elevate their level of play and match wits with the most cunning opponent available on a personal computer.
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings
description: Age of Empires II: The Age of Kings is the sequel to the award-winning, best-selling real-time strategy game Age of Empires. Age of Empires II spans a thousand years, from the fall of Rome through the Middle Ages in which players lead one of 13 civilizations into greatness. You start off small, with nothing more than a town center and a few peasants and from this meager beginning slowly add infrastructure to your civilization that either enhances your resource gathering or pumps out tons of varied military units. The game keeps the epic scope of Age of Empires' game play while evolving the combat and economic features.
platforms: PC PS2 Mac Cell DC PC NDS

title: Jet Force Gemini
description: One of the more difficult gaming experiences to be had for Nintendo 64, Rare's Jet Force Gemini is a third-person 3D action-shooter set to the backdrop of an entire galaxy in a war engulfed future. Players control Juno, Vela and Lupus the dog through tons of beautiful 3D environments plugging enemy after bloody enemy in order to save groups of kidnapped "Tribals" and retrieve spaceship parts. Jet Force Gemini also features a semi-cooperative mode for two-players (one player controls a targeting reticule), and various deathmatch battle options for up to four gamers. Developed and published by UK-based Rare.

title: Pocket Bowling
description: The action and excitement of using a big ball to knock down white pins comes to the Game Boy Color with POCKET BOWLING. Make your selection from six different bowlers, including an android. Once you have a bowler that matches your style of play, use the Training mode to work on picking up spares and to get the hang of the game controls. When you are ready for some action, play against a human or computer opponent in the Standard mode. If you want an extra challenge, try to win a tournament against four opponents in four different alleys. In all of the modes, getting the perfect shot requires lining it up, setting the proper amount of spin and power, and letting the ball go at the right time. Play POCKET BOWLING, and become master of the lanes.

title: Harley-Davidson: Race Across America
description: Get on your hog and cruise the United States in HARLEY DAVIDSON: Race Across America. You can choose from four different Harley Davidson motorcycles, each rated in acceleration, top speed, and handling. When you are ready to ride there are four tracks to race on: Arizona Desert, Deep South, Florida Everglades, and California Coast. So slip into your riding leathers and be an easy rider with HARLEY DAVIDSON: Race Across America.

title: Cutthroats: Terror on the High Seas
description: Action/strategy/resource management game featuring 17th Century pirate ships. The aim is to accumulate as much treasure as possible. You start with a single ship and build up from there.

title: 10-Pin Bowling
description: 10-PIN BOWLING brings you all the fun of bowling in miniature form on your Game Boy Color. Play by yourself or with a friend in 10 frames of simple straight-up bowling action. Challenge your friend to see who's better or challenge your own scores to see if you can beat them. Aim carefully and apply the right amount of strength and you'll be racking up strikes in no time. This cartridge also uses the Rumble technology so you can feel every strike and spare in the alley. 10-PIN BOWLING features everything but the stinky shoe rentals. Will you rule the lane, or will you just be another gutter ball?

title: NHL 2000
description: EA Sports is back with its newest version of the storied NHL franchise. In 2000, EA tries to add to the already in-depth game, and keeping the same features that made it the best before. It seems they have done it again. EA has introduced its career-mode, letting you play up to 10 seasons, trade, draft, watch your players grow old and nimble and retire. Sign some young studs and watch them grow into tomorrow?s superstars. Exhibition, Season, Career, Playoffs and even a skills challenge to tone your skills. NHL 2000 has everything you would possibly desire from a hockey game.

title: Driver
description: You play an undercover cop named Tanner who is hired as a driver for the mob. Of course, the cops don?t know that you are a cop, so when things go awry, they?ll hunt you down as if you were gutter trash. Should your driving skills be good enough to outwit the law (unfortunately for you, these guys are smarter than your average Roscoe P. Coltrane), you?ll move up in the mob world. Driver lets gamers relive the old Starsky & Hutch-style police chases, and then use the replay mode to create their own mini-chase scene movies. Just make sure the hero gets away -- the movies where the law wins are never any fun.
platforms: PC PS PS Mac PSP GBC iPhone PS3

title: Monster Rancher 2
description: MONSTER RANCHER 2 is the second title in the monster-raising franchise, and is what many consider to be the best on the PlayStation. You place any CD into your PlayStation which reads a segment from the disc and the data is used to generate your monster. Then you must train your monster to fight, controlling every aspect of his training from what it eats to errantry training, where your beast can learn new and more effective attack moves. Once you feel that your monster is ready to fight, you can enter it in competitions where it gains valuable experience and new moves. Your ultimate goal is to raise your monster-breeding stats from an "E" level to the revered "S" level, where you can create a host of new monsters. Along the way you'll run into a diverse cast of characters, explore the land in search of lost treasure, spar with your monster, and even receive fan mail.

title: Final Fantasy Anthology
description: A compilation of two classic Final Fantasy games -- Final Fantasy V (never released in the United States before this collection) and Final Fantasy VI (released as Final Fantasy III in the US due to the missing continuity in not having several previous FF games translated and sold in the States.) This collection features the same 2D graphics of the original supplemented with CG movie sequences.

title: Destruction Derby 64
description: Sure, there are fast-paced challenging races on tracks and great vehicles to choose from, but besides the great 3D graphics there's another level of fun unique to DESTRUCTION DERBY 64, and that's the crashes. With such crash-inducing tracks as the Figure Eight or the traditional looped track with the unusual extra of having cars racing both directions at the same time, the real fun is in the title of this smashing game: demolition! 3DO has included terrific sound effects and realistic damage like denting, breaking glass, and engine damage, so that virtual high-speed crashing becomes excellent fun. There are Demolition Races and Arena Battles to choose from in a quest for the best, and each race requires flying finishes to gain points. There is also the safe Arcade mode that you can use as a practice arena. DESTRUCTION DERBY 64 offers several multiplayer modes, like Deathmatch, a tough arena battle, Bomb Tag, and a vehicular version of hot potato.
platforms: N64 PC PS3 PS PSP Android Saturn

title: Homeworld
description: While the real-time strategy genre suffered from overused ideas and clones upon clones due to overly accessible 2D top-down engines, Relic emerged from the stratosphere with their stellar fully 3D space based RTS Homeworld. It turned out to be one of the most cinematic experiences ever created using amazing music, mind blowing spacescapes, a brilliant storyline and beautifully crafted gameplay. While controls suffered a bit because of the new 3D frontier it was trying to cross, Homeworld deserves its spot on the list and then some for its innovation and insane attention to production value and detail. Who ever thought the emptiness of space could be so atmospheric?

title: Chase H.Q. Secret Police
description: The chase is on in CHASE HQ: Secret Police for the Game Boy Color. Loosely adapted from the arcade game of the same name, CHASE HQ is a unique mix of racing and action for one or two players. In the One-Player mode, you'll lead a handpicked team of undercover cops, each with unique talents. You'll be shown what kind of vehicle the suspect is driving, and then you'll hit the streets to find him. When you finally locate the perp, you'll switch to a behind-the-vehicle view as you try to shoot or bump the criminal off the road. Once you've managed to lower their life-bar far enough, they'll pull over and you'll make the arrest. There are 10 levels of single-player action, so you'll be plenty busy as you try to collar the criminals. You can also grab a friend to play Head-to-Head using a link cable, with one person playing the cop and the other playing the bad guy. CHASE HQ: Secret Police is compatible with all Game Boy systems.

title: SEGA Bass Fishing
description: If the last thing you want to do is wake up at the crack of dawn to go freeze your butt off on a lake, all in the hopes of catching some fish, then SEGA BASS FISHING just might be what you're looking for. You'll have everything you need to bring in the big one, like 14 different lures, each with its own purpose and difficulty setting. There are also three different play modes that will challenge your skills and test your determination. The Practice mode acts as a training tool, teaching you everything from choosing the right lure to reeling the rod once you've got a bite. In Arcade mode, you'll hit three different lakes in an effort to bring home enough fish to meet your quota. Original mode is a Dreamcast exclusive, and it lets you enter a series of tournaments where you can improve your skills and move up the rankings. If you're ready to catch "the big one," then get your hands on SEGA BASS FISHING and go for it!
platforms: DC PC Xbox 360 iPhone Arcade PS3

title: Virtua Fighter 3tb
description: Virtua Fighter 3 was years ahead of its time and still the best looking arcade fighter available. Yu Suzuki has said he is determined to make the series look and play just like real fighting by the fifth installment, and the third game brought him amazingly close to his goal. A cast of twelve fighters, each sporting a unique real fighting art, battles in environments which reflect real world locations. Gone are the floating arenas seen in most other 3-D fighters -- instead, we can intricately detailed environments which go well beyond the flat plane, introducing gradual vertical shifts which may give an opponent the advantage in battle. For the first time ever, positioning really makes a difference in the fight.New to the series is the evade button, though the setup remains as simple as ever. Don't underestimate the simple control scheme though, since Virtua Fighter 3: Team Battle is easily the deepest fighter around. You simply cannot button mash your way through the ranks -- VF3:TB is all about skill. While the complex battle system may turn off some, there's no denying the game's place as one of if not the best fighting game around. Genki's port of AM2's arcade game, while less than perfect, still manages to bring all of the strategy and fun home along with most of the visual wonder.

title: FreeSpace 2
description: The dark Shivan race threatens to destroy all that is good, and it's up to the GTA and Vasudans to find the means of stopping them. Having already been virtually decimated by the battles, the allied factions must stop the deadliest enemy wave yet! Using 20 new weapons, you'll embark on nearly three-dozen detailed missions to save your people from certain demise. You'll have 70 new ships at your disposal as well each with unique pros and cons. A mission editor allows you to create your own action, and up to nine players can collaborate via the Internet.

title: Gauntlet Legends
description: Another series from the early years of Nintendo is back and in full 3D, with GAUNTLET LEGENDS for the Nintendo 64. The game sports upgrades in almost every department, especially the video and audio categories. Each level takes the player to a new and fantastic location that helps supply the backdrop to the mission, which retains the same feel of the original version. The player must assume the role of a wizard, warrior, valkyrie, or archer and fight through countless enemies to reach the exit.  Along the way, the player is able to utilize magic, as well as collect money to buy power-ups. The game uses the RAM Pak to support better visuals, amounting to a cleaner-looking game that is able to render believable characters and backgrounds. GAUNTLET LEGENDS delivers solid fun for any gamer, especially those who have followed the series.

title: Toy Story 2: Buzz Lightyear to the Rescue
description: When a greedy toy collector gets his paws on Woody, it's up to (who else?) Buzz Lightyear to swoop in and save him. As Buzz, your race is against time, but you've got your best friends (all of the toys from Disney/Pixar film) there to back you up. Hamm, Slinky, and Rex will all play key roles in helping you guide Buzz through the mayhem to get to Woody â¦ after all, that's what friends are for! Following the same plotline as the movie, TOY STORY 2 is full of intense action for all ages. Interact with all of your favorite characters over 15 expansive levels of animation that look just like the film, as you try to save your wooden buddy from peril. With five vicious bosses, including Zurg and the Evil Prospector, you're going to need special powers to get the job done. Luckily, such powers become available by unlocking toy accessories, including rocket jet boots, a grappling hook, an arm laser, and moon spring boots. Buzz makes a great videogame hero, and the humor of the series is evident throughout the game.
platforms: N64 GBC PC PS PS3 DC PSP

title: Ready 2 Rumble Boxing
description: For fans of the Sweet Science, it doesn't get any sweeter than this. Choose from a wide variety of fighters and get ready to rise through the ranks, enjoying an arcade-style take on the popular sport. The options are plentiful, as you select can from a menu of 11 different fighters (including a sumo wrestler), two different styles of boxing, five camera angles, and three skill levels. In Arcade mode, there are few rules; the aim is to beat your opponent quickly and mercilessly. The more involved Championship mode allows you to choose from three different boxers, the object being to earn cash so you can build up a personal gym. As you evolve your fighter, you'll have the option of wagering up to $20,000 on each Prize Fight. Wager wisely, though, because equipment is pricey. READY 2 RUMBLE BOXINGnis for one or two players, and you can save your stats, gym names, prizes, etc. to a Controller Pak.

title: Pharaoh
description: Hot on the heels of the classic Caesar III comes Pharaoh. Using the same gameplay mechanics as Caesar III, Pharaoh transports players to ancient Egypt, where they must farm the unforgiving Nile, defend the Egyptian borders against enemy nations, and build monuments that will stand for all time. Pharaoh is filled to the brim with addictive gameplay, lush and beautiful graphics, and enormous depth, all of which contribute to a great gaming experience.

title: Bassmasters Classic
description: Now when you can't get out to the lake, you can go fishing on your Game Boy Color with Bassmasters Classic. Choose from a variety of lures and hit your favorite fishing hole. You cast the line by stopping a power meter at one of five positions more power equals more distance. After you cast the line, you must wait for a fish to strike. When it does, get ready for a fight. Once you get the fish to the boat the game is not over, as you must stick you hand into the water and grab the catch. If you can't get a hold of it within three tries, you'll be telling stories about the one that got away. All of this action takes place in Practice and Tournament modes. If you can't get to the lake, bring the lake to you with Bassmasters Classic.

title: Omikron: The Nomad Soul
description: You are tricked and killed, and brought into an alternate universe where you slowly realize that something is terribly wrong. Oh yeah, and you also find that you can possess anybody too. That will sure come in handy in Omikron: The Nomad Soul, a third-person 3D action game that brings you to a lush, expansive and beautifully rendered 3D world. Be prepared to be dazzled by the intriguing storyline, the inventive dialogue, and cinematic cut-scenes.
rating_content: Animated Blood, Animated Violence, Mature Sexual Themes

title: Clock Tower 2: The Struggle Within
description: Alyssa has always had strange thoughts: she has flashes of violent acts involving her friends. These visions always end with her friends' deaths, and Alyssa holding a knife. After undergoing intense psychotherapy, Alyssa has learned that an apparition named Mr. Bates (residing in her mind) causes these thoughts. Luckily, an amulet protects Alyssa and keeps Mr. Bates at bay. Hoping to take a vacation, Alyssa travels to Salinas to visit a family friend. When she arrives, she learns that her host has disappeared under mysterious circumstances. You, as Alyssa and her alternate personality, will use a point-and-click interface to solve puzzles and arrive at one of the game's 13 different endings. Will Alyssa be able to figure out what happened? Play Clock Tower 2: The Struggle Within and find out.
rating_content: Animated Blood and Gore, Animated Violence

title: Septerra Core: Legacy of the Creator
description: Septerra Core is a futuristic fable set on a world of 7 continents that float, one above the other, around a central living computer core. You'll play the part of Maya, a young Junk Scavenger who lives on the second layer of Septerra Core, where inhabitants dwell among  the trash discarded by the inhabitants of the level above them. Picking a team of three characters from the game's nine, you'll set out on a quest to unlock the secrets of this bizarre and complex world.

title: Pong: The Next Level
description: This version of Pong takes you to the next level! There's a whole new realm of  stunning 3D graphics and multiple worlds of fast-paced action. Keep your opponents from scoring on over 20 levels.

title: Resident Evil 3: Nemesis
description: With the gruesome T-Virus finally dormant, Jill Valentine has resigned from S.T.A.R.S. and is going to leave what's left of Raccoon City. Much to her dismay, her exit has been delayed by the same flesh-eating zombies that plagued her counterparts in the first two games! This time, however, the undead are augmented by bloodthirsty hunters, evil hellhounds, and other terrors of the night. As Jill, you'll meet up with a lot of new faces, and some old ones too. Carlos Olivera, for example, is an Umbrella Biohazard Countermeasure Service Agent that seems to want to help you out; whether you trust him or not is up to you. Each time you meet up with an enemy, you can either confront it or evade it, but your choices all add up in this immersing tale of terror. Of course, you do have some pretty powerful ammo to back you up, and the game even lets you combine weapons to make your own firepower. The third installment in the popular RESIDENT EVIL series, this one boasts improved graphics, sound, and overall gameplay. Hidden at the end of the adventure is a bonus Mercenaries game   but you'll be lucky if you live to see it.
platforms: PS DC GCN PS3 PSP PC

title: You Don't Know Jack! [1999]
description: Do you know your history? In YOU DON'T KNOW JACK! for the PlayStation, you'll get questions asking about everything from Roman rulers to Russian royalty to members of the Simpsons family. There are over 1,500 different questions in this quiz show game, guaranteeing hours of humorous and sometimes educational gameplay. There are also three mini-games: Dis or Dat, Jack Attack, and Three Way. Each offers a different way to answer questions, calling upon gamers to ready their fingers for fast rounds. The game supports up to three people at one time, making it a great party game. The witty (and sometimes offensive) host will constantly make fun of the competitors if they take too long to answer a question or give a wrong answer. YOU DON'T KNOW JACK! not only works well as a party game, it is also a deep one-player experience that features great audio, entertaining (and sometimes educational) questions, and a television-like atmosphere.
platforms: PS LCD Mac PC Mac PC
rating_content: Comic Mischief, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes

title: LEGO Racers
description: The Nintendo 64 has seen many racing games, though none are quite like LEGO RACERS. The game, which is inspired by the building block toys, lets players build cars from one of 12 included sets of Legos. There are 24 different tracks to race on, spanning all sorts of imaginative and exciting locations. You can go at it in four racing modes, with the Circuit mode being the most involved. This mode lets you build up points throughout the races, which opens up more tracks and competition. There is also a Time race, which allows you to race against a ghost of your previous performance. The Multiplayer mode lets two people race head-to-head in their own customized vehicles in a split-screen battle. LEGO RACERS features many unique options that possibly due solely to the Lego license make it a fresh and original title.
platforms: N64 PC Cell Web PS GBC
rating_content: Suitable for Persons Ages Six and Older

title: Suikoden II
description: Sequel to the early PlayStation RPG. As a member of the Alliance, a military force only really hinted at in the original, you play the unwitting hero of the game: an orphan who has been raised by a quiet, unassuming battle hero in a seemingly ancient war. Alongside you in the ranks is your best friend Joei, a boy born of nobility but who has never been able to receive approval in his stubborn father's eyes. As the game begins, you are immediately tossed into a tale of political strife, betrayal and war on a grand scale beyond your scope in the early stages. As the game wears on, the plot will twist, turn and develop in numerous ways that expose the personalities of each of the characters involved. The battle system is turn-based, with the option to equip Runes for special abilities, combine party member attacks to create chain combos or devastating spells, and the option to run the battle in Auto mode.

title: Nations: WWII Fighter Command
description: The British, American, and German forces are battling it out for world domination, and you're positioned right in the eye of the storm. Boating historically accurate details, the game lets you pilot an aircraft for any of the three nations. There are 45 total missions to test your chops on, and 16 accurately modeled aircraft to draw from. The 3D effects allow the weather to change smoothly, while multiple difficulty settings allow you to ease into the action at your own pace. Up to 16 players can compete online.

title: Tail Concerto
description: Dogs and cats inhabit the world of Prairie. The dogs are the dominant group and have denied the cats representation in the government. The Black Cats forms to get feline representation by any means necessary. Believing that five crystals scattered in Prairie hold the key to a utopia filled with catnip, the Black Cats go after them. If the crystals are gathered, they will awaken the Iron Giant who will destroy Prairie. You take the role of Waffle, who must stop the Black Cats and save the world. Luckily, he is equipped with a robotic suit that can immobilize fleeing cats with the bubble gun, allowing the arms to capture them. After a cat is captured, it is thrown into a teleporter and sent to jail. Will Waffle be able to stop the Black Cats before they find the crystals? Find out by playing TAIL CONCERTO.

title: Psychic Force 2012
description: Step into the ring with PSYCHIC FORCE 2012 and see if you've got what it takes to emerge as a champion. The ring in PHYSCHIC FORCE is a little different than your typical battle arena; in this world, you go hand-to-hand in a weightless cube, which expands the possibilities and adds to the challenge at the same time. In other words, you can attack or be attacked from virtually any angle in this three dimensional battle zone. You'll have 10 fighters to choose from: Might, Regina, Wendy, Emilio, Setsuna, Patty, Gudeath, Genshin, Carlo, and Gates. Get your fighter in shape in the Training mode and once you feel he is ready, enter one of three battle modes: Versus, Arcade, and Story. Each character has a unique weapon and they all have energy weapons, which are good for long distance attacks. Enter the world of PSYCHIC FORCE 2012 and put your skills to the test.

title: WWF Attitude
description: WWF Attitude from Acclaim is the ultimate in wrestling titles for the Dreamcast. Just like its PSX counterpart, the Dreamcast version allows the ultimate wrestling fan to have a plethora of options to choose from to suit his particular wrestling mood. The 128-bit experience is, in itself, amazing. Team that up with good gameplay and a multitude of options makes WWF Attitude for the DC a forerunner in the wrestling ring!
rating_content: Blood, Realistic Violence, Suggestive Themes, Language

title: Tasmanian Devil: Munching Madness
description: LOONEY TUNES: TAZ MUNCHING MADNESS features Taz from the timeless cartoons from Warner Brothers in his first adventure on Game Boy Color. Playing the game gives the player the same feel as watching the cartoon show with Taz's signature twist and amusing moments. Presented in a 2D look, the graphics, and scenes on every level have a colorfully appealing view from the top down over the game play. Taz must embark on a mission to save his friend, Wendal T. Wolf from Bull Gator and his crony, Axl. Taz ventures away from his home in Tasmania and must pass through the Amazon Jungle, Amsterdam, Switzerland, the Greek Islands, China, Australia, and more. Those familiar with Taz's character on the Looney Tunes cartoons will recognize the fact that Taz hasn't lost his taste for strange and unusual objects as his food source and continues with that practice in his game. Taz literally has to eat his way through each level in order to advance to the next level. Food has significant importance how victorious Taz will be in his mission and even becomes functional at some points. The more food Taz consumes, the faster he will advance and the closer he will get to rescuing his friend. The road to the rescue will be littered with obstacles and challenges from Taz's enemies. Fans of the Looney Tunes cartoons will want to own this game as well as anyone who enjoys colorful, fast-paced and challenging game play.

title: Rippin' Riders Snowboarding
description: The phenomenally successful COOL BOARDERS series makes its way to the Dreamcast with RIPPIN' RIDERS SNOWBOARDING. You start the game with seven snowboarders to choose from each with his or her own strengths and weaknesses so you're bound to find one that fits your snowboarding style. There is only one course available when you start the game but once you meet certain parameters, new courses and even more characters and outfits become available. You have three different modes that let you strut your stuff. In the Match Race it's a one-on-one affair, you against a friend. In the Half Pipe it's all about tricks, namely how many you can pull off in the allotted time. And in the Free Race it's just you against the mountain, which is littered with huge ramps that are perfect for pulling off some impressive tricks. So slip on your longjohns and get ready to rip it up with RIPPIN' RIDERS SNOWBOARDING.

title: FIFA 2000 Major League Soccer
description: For the first time, FIFA 2000 features consecutive season play - play well and you may gain entry into European Cup Competitions; play badly and you could find yourself in a relegation dogfight.

title: Sid Meier's Alien Crossfire
description: It is a time of upheaval on Planet. As five new factions fight for recognition, Alpha Centauri's original inhabitants return to do battle above the skies of humanity's new home. As the survivors of the alien civil war fall to the surface, the factions of humanity struggle with the implications of their impending arrival. Will the humans band together to overcome the alien threat? Or will diplomacy prove more effective in dealing with the invaders?

title: Pocket Bomberman
description: US Game Boy Color version of the Japanese Pocket Bomberman, which appeared only as a regular Game Boy cartridge in its home country.

title: Earthworm Jim 3D
description: After a hard day of doing whatever earthworm superheroes do, Earthworm Jim is hit on the head by a flying cow. After lapsing into a coma, Jim awakens in his own mind and discovers that he has gone insane. In order to regain his sanity, he must travel through the various worlds in his head and collect the loose marbles, as well as the golden udders. However, these things are not just lying in easy-to-reach places. Jim will have to use all of his talents including jumping, crawling, hanging, running, helicopter spinning, and blasting enemies. Many of the classic enemies like Evil the Cat and Professor Monkey for a Head return, and all of the gameplay is what you expect from an EARTHWORM JIM game, only in 3D. Help Jim collect his marbles and return to the land of the living in EARTHWORM JIM 3D.

title: R-Type DX
description: An evil alien empire is planning to take over the Earth, and you are the only person who can save the planet. Jump into your R-Type fighter and destroy the invading aliens in R-TYPE DX. The cartridge contains the original arcade hits R-TYPE and R-TYPE II, both of which can be played in a Black-and-White or Color mode. The final option is R-TYPE DX, which is the first two games, played back-to-back. No matter what version you play, the action involves shooting the aliens out of the sky with your fighter. Luckily, there are a huge number of power-ups scattered throughout the various levels, including fire chains and bubble beams. As an added bonus, the music from the arcade game has been recreated on the Game Boy Color. Blast the aliens back to their home world in R-TYPE DX.

title: Armored Fist 3
description: As the task force commander for Armored Fist, your orders are clear - advance, engage and destroy the enemy. You control the world's most advanced battle tank, the M1A2 Abrams. Considering this brutish armor plated beast bears over 1500 horsepower and a massively destructive 18 foot-long cannon, sometimes it almost seems too easy. Armored Fist 3 adds multi-player support, built-in Voice-Over-Net technology that allows players to talk to each online while playing the game and a new 32-bit Voxel Space graphics engine which allows more realistic terrain and effects.

title: Trickstyle
description: Trickstyle is a futuristic hover-board racing game. The game has an exceptional physics engine, state of the art character animations and accurate collision spheres. TrickStyle's node based track design allows for multiple routes through each of the courses, enhancing replay value.

title: A Collection of Intellivision Classic Games
description: Back in the early days of home consoles, two machines dominated the market: the Atari 2600 and the graphically superior Intellivision. Now, those who remember playing the Intellivision can remember their youth with INTELLIVISION CLASSIC GAMES. You get 30 Intellivision classics: ARMOR BATTLE, ASTROSMASH, AUTO RACING, BASEBALL, BASKETBALL, BOXING, CHECKERS, CHESS, FOOTBALL, FROG BOG, GOLF, HOCKEY, HOVER FORCE, LAS VEGAS POKER Â¿N' BLACKJACK, NIGHT STALKER, PINBALL, SEA BATTLE, SHARK! SHARK!, SHARP SHOT, SKIING, SNAFU, SOCCER, SPACE ARMADA, SPACE BATTLE, SPACE HAWK, SPIKER! SUPER PRO VOLLEYBALL, STADIUM MUD BUGGIES, STAR STRIKE, SUB HUNT, and TENNIS. INTELLIVISION CLASSIC GAMES is for anyone who owned an Intellivision and wants to relive his or her youth.

title: Ms. Pac-Man
description: All of the action and fun of the first feminist arcade game can be put in the palm of your hand with MS. PAC-MAN: Special Color Edition. You take control of the yellow disk adorned with lipstick and a pink bow, better known as the lovely Ms. Pac-Man. The goal is to guide her around the maze and eat all of the dots, avoiding the four ghosts that chase you. There are power pellets located in each corner of the maze which, when eaten, turn the ghosts blue. Once this happens, the ghosts can be eaten. Occasionally, fruit will float into the maze, which can be munched for extra points. If your friends want to play along, there is an alternating Two-Player mode. As an additional bonus, a complete version of SUPER PAC-MAN is included on the cartridge. Play as the first female arcade hero in MS. PAC-MAN: Special Color Edition.
platforms: GBC Xbox One PS4 PC NES GB LCD iPod Lynx 7800 2600 Cell TI-99 iPad 400/800 SMS Xbox GG Arcade 5200 SNES

title: Revenant
description: Locke D'Averam is the Revenant, a resurrected warrior from an earlier age. Summoned by a powerful warlord to rescue his abducted daughter, Locke embarks on a quest that will take him through a myriad of sinister locations, collecting magic items and battling a host of fearsome monsters. As he attempts to recover his fighting skills he is plagued by memories of his past existence, memories that begin to merge with his current quest in a series of stunning revelations. Revenant is played from a third person isometric point of view similar to Diablo, but adds an important gameplay element to its combat sequences: combos. Players can perform different combination attacks with different keystrokes, which adds quite a bit of depth to the game.

title: Madden NFL 2000
description: The players may look pint-sized, but you'll still find all the hard-hitting action of the NFL in MADDEN NFL 2000. Choose from all 31 of the NFL teams and hit the field for an Exhibition Match-up or a Sudden Death game, where the team that scores first wins. If you are looking for a challenge, fight your way through the Season to make the Playoffs and maybe even the Super Bowl. Or you can just skip the Season and head straight to the Playoffs. All of the elements of pro football are here: substitutions, reverse plays, audibles, diving catches, and so much more. With over 150 different offensive and defensive plays, the playing style of each team can be recreated. Put on a helmet and get ready for some football with MADDEN NFL 2000.

title: Paperboy (2000)
description: The much loved arcade classic returns in glorious 3D action in Paperboy 64 from Midway. You play as the eager young paperboy of the title, and it's your wheel-screeching duty to hop on your bicycle and deliver all your precious Daily Sun newspapers while avoiding grumpy neighbors, crazed gorillas, thirsty vampires, and swirling tornadoes. Choose your routes, aim your shots carefully, and send the papers flying to your customers' waiting doorsteps. Just make sure to be quick, as the time limit is ticking away as you ride. For extra points grab hold of the handlebars, catch some air, and break out some sick bike tricks. Deliver enough papers and you unlock devious bosses like Dr. Tesla and Killa Gorilla. You'll need to collect as many helpful power-ups you can, like extra time and health, to two-wheel it to victory. Seaside communities, campgrounds, trailer parks, and suburban neighborhoods all wait to challenge your riding and delivering skills in Paperboy 64.

title: Ballistic
description: Looking for an intense puzzler packed with insane chain reactions and addictive gameplay modes? Look no further than BALLISTIC on Game Boy Color. In this puzzle game, you control a cannon in the center of the playing field that can shoot balls of varying colors in any direction. Balls form a spiral from the center of the screen out, and you must clear them by matching colors from your own cannon. If the balls reach the outer edge of the screen, it's game over. Choose from three different gameplay modes. In Panic mode, blast the blazing balls Â¿til you can't blast no more! The game will continue until you decide to stop, so show what you're made of and last as long as you can. In Checkmate mode, you must solve 50 unique puzzles using your strategic prowess! Can you set up the right chain reactions? Finally, challenge an opponent to a two-player contest to prove who has the best puzzle skills!

title: NHL Championship 2000
description: NHL Championship from Fox Sports is known as the hockey title for the new millennium. Some of the best graphics and quality game play the PlayStation has seen. All rosters are up to date. Kenny Albert is in the booth and other than the catch Fox Sports theme music, sound isn't anything special.

title: Rising Zan: The Samurai Gunman
description: While investigating a series of mysterious disappearances in the 1800s, Johnny is knocked from his horse by an unidentified being. When he tries to shoot the creature he is rendered unconscious, only to be awakened later on by his father's long-time friend Suzuki. Suzuki, it seemed, had saved Johnny's life and decided to take the youngster under his wing to teach him the art of Zipang fighting. When Johnny returned to his home in the West many years later as the Samurai Gunman Zan, he found his town being ravaged by a ninja group looking for gold. You control Zan as you use your sword and your six-shooter to take out the enemies. It won't be easy, as you'll encounter ninjas, Sumo wrestlers, straw men, henchmen, and more in your pursuit of their leader, Queen Jackal. The more foes you eliminate over the game's 10 levels, the more points you'll get toward improving the power of your sword or the speed of your movement. After completing each level, your performance will earn you hero badges. The more badges you receive, the more secret modes and rewards you'll be able to unlock at the game's end. It's East meets West in this addicting action hybrid.

title: Space Invaders
description: Space Invaders for PlayStation is an enhanced 3d version of the Atari game. Battle squadron after squadron of alien forces as they pulse down through the menacing sky. You must save the galaxy! There's 100 levels of lightning-fast arcade action. Test your rapid-fire skills against 13 deadly enemy species and 10 huge bosses as you defend the galaxy from constant invasion. There are two player cooperative or competitive modes.
platforms: PS Wii 5200 PC PC GB 2600 GBA LCD N64 DC WS NES Wii SNES Arcade GBC 400/800 LCD LCD LCD

title: Spy Hunter / Moon Patrol
description: Look no further than ARCADE HITS: Moon Patrol & Spy Hunter for classic fun on the run for Game Boy and Game Boy Color. Featuring two classic arcade action titles, ARCADE HITS is packed full of fun. In SPY HUNTER, you play a super spy trying to thwart the nefarious plots of your adversaries. Take to the road in your souped-up roadster in a thrilling overhead chase. Collect power-ups to increase your firepower, oil slicks to give the baddies the slip, and more. Take out as many of the enemies as you can, but watch out for civilians or you'll have some explaining to do! MOON PATROL takes you to the surface of the Moon, driving a fully armed dune buggy in side-scrolling mayhem. Blast away at the Moon critters that are out to get you, and keep an eye out for craters! Both games are perfect graphical reproductions of the vintage arcade machines. Classic and modern gamers can't go wrong with this awesome duo of games!

title: The King of Fighters: Dream Match 1999
description: The best way to describe KING OF FIGHTERS: Dream Match 1999 would be to take every combatant from the previous games in the KING OF FIGHTERS series, and put them in one superstar matchup. You'll have over 40 fighters to choose from, including Ryo Sakazaki, Chizuru Kagura, and Goro Daimon. Pit them against each other in a ton of cool 2D environments that will put your skills to the test. Show your stuff in Team Play, Team Versus, Single Play, Single Versus, Survivor, and Practice. With so many modes and characters to choose from, your thumbs better be in good shape, or you'll spend most of your time facedown in defeat. In addition to your standard light kick, heavy kick, light punch, and heavy punch, there are special moves that you must master in order to be successful and crown yourself the ultimate King of Fighters.
platforms: DC Arcade Switch NG PS PS3 3DS NGCD PSP

title: Extreme Wintersports
description: If you've always wanted to travel to the Winter Olympics but you just can't take the frostbite and overpriced food you'll love this new twist on winter games. See how you stack up in events like Snowmobiling, Skiing, and Snowboarding. Prior to each race, you'll be able to enter a Pro Shop, where equipment, upgrades, and hip accessories can be bought with cash you've won. Choose your racer, decide which slope looks the most promising, and set all of the track options. Then, make your opponents eat snow. Up to four players can participate.

title: Logical
description: LOGICAL adds a distinctive puzzle game experience to the Game Boy Color. Each of the 99 levels starts with a unique arrangement of pipes and slotted gears. Balls of various colors roll through a pipe at the top of the screen, and they'll fall into the gear and pipe arrangement. The goal is to get balls of the same color to fill all of the slots of a gear. Once that happens, the balls disappear. But time is always a factor in doing this, so you've got to be efficient. As the game progresses, several complicating factors enter the mix: some pipes will only allow balls to travel one way, and other will only let balls of one color pass through. The biggest problem is that some levels require colors be removed in a particular order. Try to solve as many puzzles as you can with LOGICAL.

title: Knockout Kings 2000
description: Enjoy all of the thrilling challenges of professional boxing with KNOCKOUT KINGS 2000. You can choose from large number of past and present boxing greats like Marvelous Marvin Hagler, Rocky Marciano, Evander Holyfield, Roberto Duran, and Muhammad Ali. Enter a slugfest, and try to knock out your opponent opposition in an arcade-style boxing match. If you are looking for something more realistic, put the boxers into an Exhibition match. For the most hardcore boxing fanatics, you can recreate great boxing matches, including the Thrilla in Manilla. For the ultimate challenge, create your own boxer and fight your way through the ranks to the world championship. Unlike last year's game, players now control the training that takes place between matches. If you are a fan of the sweet science, you will love KNOCKOUT KINGS 2000.

title: South Park
description: When a comet almost collides with Earth, a posse of bizarre turkeys and evil aliens lands in South Park, and the four foul-mouthed grade-schoolers are, of course, going to have to rescue everyone. Switch back and forth between the characters with the touch of a button, as you use yellow snowballs, sponge-dart guns, toilet plungers, and more to squelch the strange attack and restore peace to the sleepy mountain town. With lots of levels and difficult bosses, the game's obvious strength is its creativity the enemies are all hysterical, and the game ends up being as funny as the show itself. Based on the hit cartoon, SOUTH PARK (the game) actually uses custom speech from stars Trey Parker, Matt Stone, and Isaac Hayes to keep the faithful masses happy, and adds a creative storyline that falls right in line with what you'd expect from the show. The 3D animation is a definite update on the cartoon, but the animation is so good, you won't even blink at the difference. If you've never used a bazooka that shoots out cows in a videogame before, you haven't played SOUTH PARK.

title: Tom and Jerry
description: The famous cat and mouse duo makes an appearance on the Game Boy Color in TOM AND JERRY. Take control of Jerry as he searches for his cousin Tuffie. To succeed, Jerry will have to explore 10 expansive levels filled with bottomless pits and spikes. In addition to these dangers, Jerry must keep an eye out for Tom who will eat him the first chance he gets. Luckily, Jerry can collect marbles that will slow Tom down and keep him away. In addition to the marbles, there are a large number of power-ups that will help Jerry while he searches including cheese, ice cream sodas, stars, clocks, and hearts. Will Jerry be able to find Tuffie? Can Tom capture the mouse and have him for lunch? Find out by playing TOM AND JERRY.

title: WinBack: Covert Operations
description: A terrorist group calling itself the Crying Lions is about to take over the world with its mighty satellite, and Jean-Luc Cougar is the only one who can stop it. As Jean-Luc, a covert operative working for the Strategic Covert Actions Team, you are responsible for taking back a Lions-controlled base and regaining power of the satellite. Some of the weapons you'll have to acquire and use to defeat the terrorists are handguns, shotguns, and machine guns, though you'll also need to access such materials as explosives, detectors, flashlights, and medical kits in order to succeed. A refreshing take on the traditional action game, WINBACK requires as much stealth and strategy as it does reflexes and use of weaponry. The game features six different multiplayer modes, supporting up to four players: Death Match, Lethal Tag, Quick Draw, Cube Hunt, Team Battle, and Point Match. You select your difficulty level, and you can even start off in a Tutorial mode to get the controls down.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater
